definition: can be found everywhere
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
all/each and every/in all cases
is/are/am/yes/to be

sentences.english: Sometimes, people do not exhibit symptoms but are herpes carriers all the same.
sentences.chinese: 那些沒有表現出明顯症狀的皰疹病毒攜帶者比比皆是。

sentences.english: Apocryphal information abounds, blurring the boundary between truth and rumor.
sentences.chinese: 未經證實的信息比比皆是，模糊了真相和謠言的邊界。

sentences.english: It covers an area of 290 hectares，and has halls，pavilions，corridors and bridges almost everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 它佔地290公頃，亭臺樓閣和迴廊小橋比比皆是。

sentences.english: Other unpublicised vulnerabilities are common and could be used by a well-financed aggressor, experts said.
sentences.chinese: 專家表示，其它未經公開的漏洞比比皆是。

sentences.english: In many instances, wives or girlfriends, are now the higher-income earning partners, and are treated as equals.
sentences.chinese: 妻子或女友收入更高的情況比比皆是。

sentences.english: Good people and good deeds can be found everywhere.
Mr Ramo's book is full of engaging vignettes like this.
sentences.chinese: 此類引人入勝的小故事在拉莫先生的書中比比皆是。

sentences.english: All-rounder can't take place of perseverance. It's ubiquitousness that an all-rounder can't achieve succeed.
sentences.chinese: 全才不能取代堅持，是全才而沒有成功的人比比皆是。

sentences.english: The market-place was full of women, the streets packed with men.
sentences.chinese: 商場裏婦女摩肩接踵，街上男人比比皆是。

sentences.english: A minority of millions is not at all unusual.
sentences.chinese: 數量上達數百萬之衆的少數派比比皆是。

sentences.english: Any day now, you expect to hear rumblings about bringing back the 55 mile-per-hour speed limit.
sentences.chinese: 最近美國或將重拾55英里限速規定的傳言比比皆是。

sentences.english: Tales of peddlers becoming small merchants are legon.
sentences.chinese: 沿街叫賣的小販發展成小商人的故事比比皆是。

sentences.english: Oxford is full of curious old customs like that.
sentences.chinese: 象這樣古怪的陳習在牛津比比皆是。

sentences.english: At a time when the nation is obsessed with sloganeering about honesty … dishonesty is still a plague.
sentences.chinese: 在全國都在標榜誠信的時候，不誠信仍然比比皆是。

sentences.english: Weifang love blowing, middle of the night on the beer Shaokao Tan everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 濰坊人愛吹，半夜啤酒燒烤攤上比比皆是。

sentences.english: But there are many bright and motivating examples of success everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 但是，許多催人奮進的成功光輝例證比比皆是。

definition: too many to count (idiom); innumerable
a common occurrence (idiom)
too numerous to list (idiom); innumerable
there are plenty of such people
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
as many as the hair of the ox (idiom)/great amount of/countless
a common occurrence (idiom)
there is no lack of
lit. so numerous that one could just bend down and pick them up (idiom)/fig. extremely common/easily available
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
a common occurrence (idiom)
very few/very little
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
see 俯拾皆是[fu3 shi2 jie1 shi4]
for the most part/many/most/the greater part/mostly
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
